org.flixel
Class FlxButton

java.lang.Object
  org.flixel.FlxPoint
      org.flixel.FlxRect
          org.flixel.FlxObject
              org.flixel.FlxGroup
                  org.flixel.FlxButton

public class FlxButton
extends FlxGroup

A simple button class that calls a function when clicked by the mouse. Supports labels, highlight states, and parallax scrolling.

Field Summary
 boolean pauseProof
          Set this to true if you want this button to function even while the game is paused.

Constructor Detail

FlxButton

public FlxButton(float X,
                 float Y,
                 FlxButtonListener Callback,
                 int Width,
                 int Height)
Creates a new FlxButton object with a gray background and a callback function on the UI thread.

Parameters:
X - The X position of the button.
Y - The Y position of the button.
Callback - The function to call whenever the button is touched.
Width - The width of the button.
Height - The height of the button.

loadGraphic

public FlxButton loadGraphic(FlxSprite Image,
                             FlxSprite ImageHighlight)
Set your own image as the button background.

Parameters:
Image - A FlxSprite object to use for the button background.
ImageHighlight - A FlxSprite object to use for the button background when highlighted (optional).
Returns:
This FlxButton instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).

Add a text label to the button.

Parameters:

This FlxButton instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
